channel.title: How do I jar this? [PI] [317]
channel.description:
Hi, I'm a noob compared to all of you. And I really want to get started with my own private server.
1. Yes I have a vps, and I am configuring my IP with the client, and everything is ready.
2. I just want to jar this client, nothing more.
3. What I am asking in terms of this thread is: What do I set my input directory to, I tried: Bin, Sign. Didn't work.
Here's a screen-shot of what's in the bin folder, and what's in the client (sign obviously [only] has signlink.class, and signlink.java)
Bin Folder (Inside): [url=http://prntscr.com/58ih33]http://prntscr.com/58ih33[/url]
Whole entire Client Folder: [url=http://prntscr.com/58ihas]http://prntscr.com/58ihas[/url]
What I am putting in Jar Maker: [url=http://prntscr.com/58ihfn]http://prntscr.com/58ihfn[/url]
Keep in mind, I'm very new to RSPS. Thanks, also this is a Project Insanity (PI).
Help ASAP!
Also, yes I have searched YT/R-S/M-S/ and other forums, and none of them seem to work for this PI 317.
Any help would be appreciated.

item.title: How do I jar this? [PI] [317]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Your input directory is where all the .class files are, so the bin folder.

Your error is because the .jar file is expecting parameters on start-up (those things you see after the word Jframe in the run.bat) and you’re not supplying them.

I believe in the startUp method of client.java you can set those parameter’s defaults so you don’t need them for the client.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I jar this? [PI] [317]
item.dc:creator: @Freighted Freighted
item.description:
@Freighted wrote:

My error is: What do I put the input directory as? either way here is the batch file error for me:

RS2 user client - release #317
Usage: node-id, port-offset, [lowmem/highmem], [free/members], storeid
Press any key to continue . . .

This is my run.bat for the client:
@echo off
title Client
java -Xmx300m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32
pause

Read full topic

item.title: How do I jar this? [PI] [317]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Your settings look fine? Do you sign the jar after making it?
Also, what is your error, exactly?
If the client opens and closes (or does nothing) check the “Generate Batch File” box and re-jar. then run the .jar using the .bat the program just made. Your errors should print out in that console.

Read full topic
